meanings.definition: Treat (a material) with heat to increase its calorific value.
meanings.sent1: The chef calorized the vegetables to enhance their nutritional content.
meanings.sent2: The factory calorized the coal to make it burn more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The scientist calorized the marshmallows, turning them into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The sun calorized the sand, making it scorching hot to walk on.
meanings.sent5: The baker calorized the dough, creating a perfectly golden crust.

meanings.definition: To make something more calorific by treating it with heat.
meanings.sent1: She calorized the milk to make it richer for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The process calorized the food, making it more satisfying to eat.
meanings.sent3: The campers calorized their marshmallows, turning them into gooey treats.
meanings.sent4: The artist calorized the paint, giving it a deeper hue.
meanings.sent5: The chef calorized the sauce, intensifying its flavor.
